Key Match Events: Milwaukee Brewers won both games of the doubleheader against Cincinnati Reds
Brewers scored 10 runs in the ninth inning of Game 2
DL Hall pitched seven scoreless innings
Pre-Game Insights: Brewers focused on winning each game and managing their bullpen
Manager Pat Murphy emphasized not saving relievers for the second game
Post-Match Reflections: Players and manager expressed pride in the team's performance
Brewers improved their standings and playoff chances
Miscellaneous Highlights: Game was played in high temperatures
Brewers had the best run differential in the NL
Brewers tied for second-best record in the NL
Others: William Contreras and Willy Adames homered in both games
